text: Lenine Cunha (born 4 December 1982) is a Paralympic athlete from Portugal who competes in T20 classification long jump and triple jump events. Cunha represented Portugal at the 2000 Summer Paralympics in London, in both the long jump and the 100 metre sprint. It would be 12 years until Cunha could again compete at the Paralympics due to the T20 classification being removed from the program due to a scandal at the 2000 Games in Sydney. With the reintroduction of the T20 class at the 2012 London Games he finished third to take the bronze medal in the long jump. In 2015 Cunha won the gold medal in the triple jump at the IPC World Championships in Doha. == References == Category:Paralympic athletes of Portugal Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Paralympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Portugal Category:Living people Category:1982 births Category:Portuguese male long jumpers Category:Portuguese male triple jumpers Category:Portuguese male sprinters Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:Sportspeople from Vila Nova de Gaia Category:Paralympic medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Lenine Cunha
